title: after the storm | min yoonji
body:
5.8k | ANGST & fluff | college!au | min yoonji x reader |

warning: illness, trauma, character death (it’s not explicitly detailed death scenes or anything), lesbophobia, closeted lesbians. if rb’d please don’t tag as fem yoongi or cr*ss/  dressing

You can’t even remember the last time you’ve taken a well-deserved break, let alone had a good time out and about with your closest friends.

It really has been ages, but it isn’t by choice… Well, maybe you did kind of do this to yourself, but not as a conscious decision. You’re just so fucking busy– Constantly smothered with assignment after assignment, and with your terrible time management skills, you’re always rushing to get things done just in the nick of time. It’s because of this that you’re constantly playing a catch-up game that saps up any free time you might possibly have. You’re usually crammed in your apartment because of this and a lot of the time your head is a mess of formulas you don’t care for and poets you can’t care to remember. But this week is different.

Lately, you’ve taken on a new regimen when you work on your assignments and it keeps you focused enough to get your work together without the distractions. You’ve been doing so well as of late that you’ve finally had some time where instead of hunching over a desk full of papers, you’re just chilling out without a single educational thing on your mind. It’s peaceful, really. So when your close friend Jungkook hits you up one day, practically begging you to spend some time at his place, you’re happy to say that you can agree without much of a regret in doing so.

The drive down is long, but you’re anxious to see Jungkook as well as his roommates, which happen to be more friends of yours. You live far from them all and you longed to see them for ages now, so to say you are excited it an understatement. As you drive, you can practically hear Jungkook’s teasing quips and remarks now– He always had a stupidly sharp tongue and a mouth that moved faster than his god damn brain, so the bullshit that flies from his mouth is… Interesting, to say the least.

Then there’s Jimin, the demonic entity you’ve had the absolute pleasure and displeasure of knowing. He’s crazy intelligent, but underhanded all the same– You can still remember that one time he nearly dragged you into a robbery. He had it all planned out, all wrapped up in a pretty red bow and with those cute, plump lips of his and that easy going smile, you could’ve fallen for it. His plan, he admitted later when it all fell through, was for you to be the getaway driver for another person who would do the actual robbery and it could’ve worked if you didn’t know him so well…

Of course, you kinda knew what was up since you’ve done something similar among many, many other things. You try not to think about that part in your life much. Between the near fucking deaths and necromancy, you really were an entirely different person compared to who you are now. It’s growth, really.

You’re sure you’ll see Taehyung, too, yet another creative character. He’s an art major as well a self-proclaimed artistic genius and intellectual even though he borderline fails every single fuckin class besides those pertaining to art. He really is a wonder when it comes down to it, though, and in more ways than one. One time he was failing literature and managed to dig up enough dirt on his married literature teacher’s affair with yet another teacher that she had literally no other option than to boost Taehyung’s grade up to an A. It lasted for the entire year, too, and then when Taehyung changed courses he snitched anyway. When you asked him about it he just said something along the lines of “she earned it” and nothing else at all on the matter ever again, so yeah. That’s Kim Taehyung.

When you finally pull into the parking lot of their apartment complex and park, you’re exhausted. Ravenous, too– Your dumb ass forgot to eat before you left, of all things, and you know once Jungkook finds out about that as well as you’re rather unstable eating habits, he’ll probably have a knife to your neck and spoon feed you himself. You wouldn’t mind it much, though, because that’s the way Jungkook is and how he expresses affection. Also… you wouldn’t mind him waiting on you hand and foot to cater to you. In fact, you might just fuck around and collapse as soon as you step into the apartment just so he can do exactly that… Fuck yeah.

You hop out of the car, rolling your neck and shoulders. Your muscles pop as you dig out your phone, pulling up Jungkook’s number to shoot him a text.

“hey”
“im outside”

You begin typing your third text message, but by the time you get to the word my of “help me get my bags out the car” you can hear the sound of a door flying open somewhere and a loud, cheery voice absolutely screaming–

“IT’S MY FUCKING GIRL!”

With his arms outstretched wide and a cheeky, blinding grin, you look up to see Jungkook standing at the doorway of a nearby unit. You grin, chuckling lightly as you throw up your hand in a wave. He’s so happy, so, so happy that he doesn’t even realize the glass screen door is swinging back until it hits him.

Literally…

Hits him.

It swings back into his face hard enough for him to flinch as the sound of glass hitting skin rings clear and he loses his balance, fucking collapsing right then and there. You flinch yourself at the impact and cringe.

“…Ah,”

You mumble it aloud softly as you slowly drop your arm. Looks like Jungkook still has that clumsy, awkward phase going on. It’s cute, yeah. In a sad sort of way.

You see Jimin appear behind the door, see him staring down at his roommate with an almost tired look. Jungkook raises his arm up as if asking for Jimin’s help and to your very little surprise, Jimin just fucking steps over Jungkook’s body and out the door.

“Y/n!” Jimin calls, hopping down the steps with graceful, vigorous movements, glancing up between you and the stairs beneath his feet as if the interaction with Jungkook never happened.

Soon he touches the ground and dashes up to you with rushed movements, but the sight of the male has you borderline swooning. Jimin is utterly, wholly, entirely adorable. The way the sun is shining down, beams of light kissing his honey cheeks and staining his skin in its healing light, his dark eyes like crescents, arms out wide, he looks like a devious little angel– You don’t know whether to be scared or happy to see his dangerously pretty ass. In the next moment, Jimin is slinging his arms around you before you can decide which part of your fight or flight response you want to utilize and christ is his hug tight– Bone crushing, honestly. Still, he smells like pancakes and warm syrup, like all the good things you adore. Like home, really. As your arms wrap around the male in return, you almost feel like you’re safe in his grasp.

…Almost.
You know damn well never to totally let your guard down around that demon.

“Oh god, Y/n, it’s been so long,” He pulls away to look you over, “…How are you? Are you well? Ahh–”

His hands suddenly grip your cheeks and turns your head from side to side hard enough for your damn neck to pop.

“Oh goodness, your skin is…”

He pauses, milky eyes gazing into your own for a moment. You can feel yourself burning by the second because he’s staring at you so fucking intently, until–

“Y/n, your skin is really dried out. Do you even moisturize? Do you just rub fucking acid on your face? What the fuck?” He squints, lips parting, “…Why is it so dry…”

See?
This is why you have trust issues with Park Jimin– It’s always some sneaky, underhanded bullshit with him.

He twists your head a couple more times, your neck pops, and it takes you physical effort to keep from swinging on him.

“Aight, aight. I get it my face is ugly, jesus christ,” You grab his hands and jerk them off of your skin, “You couldn’t just say hey like a regular person, Park?”

“First of all,” Jimin starts, cocking a brow. He wiggles his hands until he holds your own, “Never said you’re ugly. You’re the prettiest girl in the whole wide world, Petunia~”

His tone turns flirtatiously melodic and your groan with a roll of your eyes.

“I see the months apart haven’t changed that part of you,” You mumble.

“What part?” Counters Jimin with enthusiastic defiance, perking up, “The part of me that still feels nothin’ but a– a burning desire to be with you? The part of me that wants you!?”

“Oh my god– Jimin,” You hiss with a scowl, “Don’t say that so loudly. It’s weird.”

You’re really a bit embarrassed because he’s borderline yelling and it doesn’t help at all that you can see an older African lady on her porch watching the two of you from a distance. She looks almost disgusted, kinda, but you get it. For some reason, you have the feeling if you saw a scene like the one you’re currently in, you’d be disgusted too.

“Why not?” Jimin replies, leaning against your car as he eases closer to you, “Embarrassed, Petunia?”

“More like disgusted,” You remark with a snarl to your lips and a gag to punctuate your words. You spin around, ignoring Jimin’s immediate pout when you’re no longer within flirting range. You walk to the other side of the car, pull open the door, grab your purse off the floor of the back seat, and gesture rather vaguely to the rest as Jimin approaches.

“Help me get my bags out the car and invite me in already,” You ask– No, demand, “A certain bitch is tired, her back hurts, and if she doesn’t get something in her guts soon, her stomach is just gonna start eating away at itself.”

“I could put something in your guts now,” Jimin says with a smug smile and coy shrug, “If you want it. No cooking required– I could have you satisfied in seconds, Petunia.”

You glance him over, brows raised. Your expression is almost impressed, honestly. Jimin is beginning to feel flushed with pride at his little remark when your brain shuts down and you fucking reply with a genuine–

“Oh fuck, you carry a Snickers on you?”

Jimin’s face drops, “W… Wait, what–”

“Can I have it?” You go on, “I’m fucking starving. I think if I don’t eat soon my organs are gonna shut down or something.”

Jimin pauses.

“I, uh. That wasn’t… what I meant,” He shifts from foot to foot, your oblivious expression only making things worse.

“Y/n, I was talking about my di–”

“Baby!”

You gasp, wind entirely knocked out of you when strong arms suddenly wrap around your form. He squeezes you tightly from behind, but it feels more like you’re being attacked than affectionately hugged.

“Oh FUCK, Jungkook!” You screech when you realize it’s him, “You scared the shit outta me– Hey, get off! I can’t breathe!”

“Sorry, sorry–” Jungkook mumbles, but he hesitates a moment before finally pulling away.

You turn to look at him with a playful glare, punching his chest lightly.

“I see you’re still the same clumsy motherfucker, huh?” You tease, punching him again as your glare turns into a grin, “What was that up there at the balcony? You were practically sucker punched by a fucking door, you know that?”

“Hey, that’s rude to say when you only just got here,” Jungkook whines, shoving you back in your shoulder, “I got hurt saying hi to you so technically it’s your fault I’m hurt.”

“Nuh uh!” You exclaim, slamming your palms into his chest, “You’re the clumsy jackass so it’s not my fault.”

“Yes,” He shoves you back, “It is, too, your fault.”

“It is not!”

“It is, too!”

“Is not!”

“Is, too!”

“Is n–”

But before you can finish, Jimin clamps his hand over your mouth and exhaustedly says, “You both sound like two full-fledged fucking fools, I swear to god. Can we go inside already?”

You and Jungkook glance back at him, a pout on your face.

“Fine,” You huff, ripping Jimin’s hand away from your face.

You step aside, letting Jimin and Jungkook get your two suitcases for you. It’s when the three of you are walking toward the apartment with Jimin leading the way, you whisper hotly–

“Is not, Jeon Jungkook, my fault.”

Just for extra measure, you dig your fingers into Jungkook’s waist and smile smugly when he squirms under your touch. The three of you walk closer still until Jimin pauses just before the stairs. You know him so well– So extremely well that when his plump lips part and a dazzling grin graces his handsome face, when he respectfully dips his head toward the African woman on her porch, you know almost instantaneously that he’s forcing it. And Jungkook, too, is forcing his smile as he bows lightly toward the woman. Really, they both look… Nervous. You’re intrigued.

Jimin starts first.

“Hello, bibi–”

“Don’t talk to me.”

And all it takes is for her to say those four words for Park Jimin to shut his fucking mouth. You watch as he leans back, chewing his inner cheek as he nods pointlessly, a defeated expression on his face. Even Jungkook looks like he’s been silenced and he never even said anything. You’re amazed, honestly. Clearly, this woman commands a lot of respect already– You can tell by the way her plump lips stay in a tight line, how her dark eyes are so focused and how her gaze is strict, as if she takes zero bullshit. Really, its like she can see right through Jungkook and Jimin. Or maybe they just really pissed her off. Could be both, though.

…It’s probably both.

“That your boyfriend?”

“Huh?” You reply, a bit surprised when she suddenly addresses you. She looks just as powerful when she glares at you and you suddenly feel as meek as Jungkook and Jimin.

“Your boyfriend,” She asks again, but it’s much less like a question and much more like a demand. She nods her head at Jimin and you jump, finally getting her question.

“Oh!” You exclaim, scrambling for words as you wave your hands dismissively, “No, Jimin and I, we, uh, we’re just–”

“If he’s your boyfriend, you should know he cheating on you,” She announces immediately.

You would guess you took too long to answer her and that’s why she phrased it that way if it weren’t for the fact that she just said what she said. You stutter in your words, broken syllables falling from your lips as you quickly turn to look at Jimin. He looks caught and the funny part about it is that the two of you aren’t even dating.

Jimin, embarrassed, scrambles for an explanation as he glances between you, Jungkook, and finally to Bibi.

“Wait, no, bibi,” he chuckles nervously, “Y/n and I aren’t–”

“I’ve been livin’ here for fourteen years and in the last few months these children have been here, I’ve seen every kind of girl you can imagine in and out that apartment. Its either you’re runnin’ ‘round or you must be trying to raise an orphanage, cuz this is the sixth girl ive seen you with this week.”

“Jimin, oh my god…"You mumble, barely keeping in your laughter. You fake like you’re shocked, cupping your hand over your mouth. Then, in a twisted sort of way, you say, "I can’t believe you’re cheating on me–”

“Y/n–” Jimin hisses, fucking exhausted. His eyes flare with a warning when he glares at you, but it’s not like his three-foot tall self could beat your ass anyway, so the chances of you actually stopping are very low.

“What happened, Jimin?” You go on, faking total shock, “In the parking lot just now, you were just talking about the part of you that still feels a burning desire to be with me? What happened to the part of you that wants me!?”

You swear you see Jimin’s eye twitch and you know for an absolute, complete fact he is already thinking of ways to get you back. He’s probably considering lighting your precious clothes on fire which, by the way, is something he has done to you before. To which you responded by nearly setting the hay atop his head that he claims to be hair on fire. And you would’ve fucking done it, too, but then his last roommate, a tall, giraffe legged motherfucker, grabbed you and you ended up fighting the roommate instead. Long story short, Jimin wound up completely physically fine and the only person who got hurt was his previous roommate, Namjoon, who ended with a black eye and then moved out. It worked in your favor though, because Jimin was so strapped on cash for months afterward trying to pay for that whole apartment by himself that you felt like you’d still gotten your revenge.

“Look, bibi, we aren’t really dating,” Jimin tries to speak calmly.

“So,” Bibi cocks a brow, “You lied when you told me your girlfriend was coming to town.”

You snort audibly, but Bibi’s quick glance has you shutting your big mouth. You mumble an apology, but really you’re just amazed at how fucking delusional Jimin is as well as how… blunt Bibi is. Jimin lies and tells her you’re his girlfriend stopping by for a visit, then Bibi, apparently aware of all the other girls Jimin’s been fucking or whatever, tattles on him the second you arrive. It’s fucking comical, honestly, but you must admit, you’re starting to like this fierce old woman.

Jimin cringes, then drops his head and nods, “Yeah… I did.”

Bibi just looks at him for a moment, her brows furrowed and lips parted in disgust, nearly. She then shakes her head and mumbles something, then waves Jimin off. She doesn’t even need to say anything else, Jimin just murmurs a “Goodbye, Bibi,” and then rushes up the rest of the steps into the apartment. Bibi glances at Jungkook too, and Jungkook awkwardly follows in Jimin’s steps and starts to leave. You’re about to say bye and part ways as well when Bibi stops you. She holds up her hand to get your attention and you freeze.

“Yes?” You tilt your head at her, “Is something wrong?”

She looks you over, as if deciding whether or not you’re worth her breath, and then says–

“Don’t sleep with that boy. The girl he was with yesterday had crabs.”

And then she gets up and walks inside of her apartment, the door banging shut behind her.

You just stand there for a moment, your mouth agape until you hear Jungkook’s voice call out to you.

“Y/n! Are you almost done talking to Bibi? I cooked and I really want us to sit down and eat together.”

“Huh?” You turn and look up at Jungkook’s expectant face. It takes you a split second to register Jungkook’s words because Bibi’s are still ringing in your ears, but you eventually do and nod.

“Y-Yeah,” You mumble, shaking your head as if to snap back into your normal self before Jungkook gets suspicious.

“I’m, uh. Comin’ up now.”

And then you grin.
And it’s fake.
…And Jungkook can tell your grin is fake as hell, but he doesn’t say anything when you make your way up and enter the apartment.

The place is neat and tidy. Homey. White walls peppered with photo after photo of Jungkook and Jimin together, of each of them separately, of Taehyung, and of Jimin and Jungkook’s family as well. The furniture is worn, but far from decayed. It is comfortably warm inside as well but the heat is mostly stemming from the kitchen. Jimin, who watches you taking everything in with an attentively curious gaze, tugs on your jacket until you follow along and shrug it off of your shoulders. He hangs it up for you and as he does, you slip off into the kitchen. You pause, leaning against the wall for a moment to deeply inhale the scent from within. It’s savory and sweet all at once, enough to have your stomach whining and mouthwatering. The sound of a spoon tapping against a pot calls you back to earth and you open your eyes to see Jungkook stirring the food.

“I.. cooked a lot,” He announces softly. Embarrassed is what he sounds like, “I didn’t know how much you would eat or what you even preferred, so I kind of got carried away.”

He grins sheepishly, then turns to glance up at you, “You will eat… right?”

You gaze at him for a moment, then grin, a wave of adoration hitting you that makes you want to pinch his cheeks.

“Oh, of course. I could eat all this–” You make a wide, general gesture out toward the kitchen, “–And then some.”

“Good!” Jungkook exclaims.

By the soft flush to his cheeks and the way he gracefully checks the oven, he’s clearly satisfied with your answer. But because you just have to fuck with people, you clear your throat and say–

“Or not.”

Jungkook freezes.

“…What?”

“Oh, you know~,” You stretch flippantly, movements flamboyant and overdramatic, “I might not actually be able to eat all of this after all.”

“Huh? Wait, no, why not?” Jungkook presses, letting go of the spoon and leaving it in the pot. He looks distressed and you know you’re being mean but you also… Don’t care enough to stop. Besides, after all the times Jungkook teased you over shit, revenge is only necessary, right?

“Are you not hungry? Or something?”

“No, no. I’m plenty hungry,” You turn around, cross your hands behind your back and deliberately edge away from him, “It’s just…”

Jungkook steps closer, tilting his head.

“Just?” He urges.

“It’s just the last time I checked, your cooking was–”

But your teasing quip is cut short when you suddenly hear a slightly feminine voice call out a groggy–

“What’s up with all the noise? This is the second time you ’ve woken me up on one of my off days,” She calls, her words tired and slurred with an accent you know well– Better than well, actually, its a sound burned into your very soul at this point.

You hear Jimin start to respond to her, but you’re already in motion. You rush out of the kitchen, almost tripping as you round the corner until suddenly you see her physically before you. And there, just down the hall, is where she stands– In clear view is no one else besides Min Yoonji. Her jet black locks are silken and messy all the same, strands sticking out here and there. Those familiar dark eyes of hers are tired– Hazy. Her tone is sun-kissed yet so pale all at once, its as if she’s fallen ill… Not like the Yoonji you once knew years back who’s skin was as vibrant as– No, rivaled with a freshly bloomed flower. The woman is dressed in a long black tee that stops just above her knees, black socks on her feet, black bags under her eyes to match her atmosphere. It’s a concoction of feelings that rush you when you see her, two of them very prominent all the same. One emotion is pure, honest, childish joy that stems from the very pit of your being the moment you lay eyes on her figure.

The second?

…Fear.

The last time you checked, Min Yoonji– your Min Yoonji did not look the way this Min Yoonji looks now. Staring at her sleek frame, her exhausted movements, you know she’s changed and it’s nowhere near for the better.

But you swallow it down, push that fear from your mind the moment you notice it and instead fall into excitement.

Yoonji looks… Shocked when she sees you. Her jaw falls slack, eyes blinking again and again as she gazes at you with hard, confused eyes. She even points at you, lips struggling to find words for a moment until all she says is–

“What?”

Jimin just giggles, grinning, “Y/n’s stopping by for a visit,” He explains simply.

“She’ll be here for the next few days,” Jungkook continues seamlessly as he too appears from the kitchen, a towel in his grasp that he dries his hands on, “We agreed not to tell you because Y/n wanted to surprise you.”

“Surpriseee~” You call, waving your hands like it’s some big reveal, the cheekiest of grins on your face.

Yoonji’s lips part and shut until finally, she finds a way to express her utter bewilderment and excitement. She rushes forward and you meet her halfway as she practically throws herself into your arms. You gasp when her chest slams into your own, stumbling back again as her arms wrap around your neck. Her grip is tight, her face nuzzled into your neck as quick, slurred comments on how much she’s fucking missed you fall from her lips. You giggle, squeezing her terribly skinny frame back, but in all honesty, she’s grown so thin you almost worry that you’ll snap her in half if you squeeze her even the slightest bit too hard.

“God, I missed you…” Yoonji hisses the words in your ear, her nails digging into your flesh.

“I missed you, tooooo!” You whine back, rocking the two of you from side to side.

In all honesty, the hug is far too short, but you and Min Yoonji are well aware of Jimin and Jungkook who stand closely behind. So you part ways just as quickly as you begin and suppress your feelings for now.

“Oh, it’s so nice to be with you all again,” You remark, glancing at Jungkook’s glimmering smile, Jimin’s flushed cheeks, and then a quick glance at Yoonji’s lips before you turn back to the boys, “If I could be here all the time, I would–”

“You should, then!” Jimin exclaims, suddenly grabbing you by your hands and pulling toward the kitchen table, “Stay with us! We’d make some room for you!”

Yoonji smirks, following along, “Yeah, we’d kick Jungkook’s ass out and you can take his room.”

“Heeey!” Jungkook retorts, glaring at your Yoonji, “Why do I get kicked out? Why not Jimin?”

“Because I can stand Jimin a little bit more than I can stand you–”

And then she jabs her pointed finger into Jungkook’s chest for extra measure. The male whines, clutching his injured chest and you giggle at the sight. Still bickering and fussing as always– They really never changed. But the lack of change in your dynamic is warming, all the same. Even after leaving for months, you can still come home to the people you love and feel nothing but comfort.

The four of you take your seats at the roundtable, Yoonji on your left, Jungook on your right, and Jimin across. When Jungkook slips into the kitchen to make the plates of food, he calls Jimin in for his help. It’s after the shorter male shoots you one of his dazzling smiles, sticks his tongue out at Yoonji, then dips off into the kitchen, you feel her hand come to squeeze your thigh. You catch her gaze for a moment, eyes hooded as you take in her form. Yoonji’s face rests in her left hand as she gazes at you with soft eyes, blinking with the slow, carefulness of a feline. A million emotions stir within her shimmering gaze and you wonder how it is possible for one person to carry stars in their eyes. You gaze down at her hand, at the bony joints and slender fingers that clutch the plump flesh of your thigh. Her hands have always been big, and you’ve always loved the way they look wrapped around your own, how they feel when they clutch your cheeks…

You laugh then when you feel the urge to kiss her hit you strong and you’re suddenly too embarrassed to even look at her anymore. Your skin, soft and supple, burns where her palm lingers– Taunting you with the sensation. Far too long has it been since the two of you seen each other last, and now that the two of you are finally together, holding back for the sake of Jimin and Jungkook is borderline hellish. The two of you are lesbians, after all, closeted lesbians, and neither one of you are ready to come out. Even with the two boys, there is always that fear that you’ll be looked at differently for admitting to being lovers– It already didn’t go well with either one of your parents. Yoonji’s momma practically disowned her when Yoonji came out to her some years ago, and your mother claims she doesn’t think of you any differently now, but you know she does. So after coming out to people who claimed to love you unconditionally only to run head-first into a condition, why risk it again?

These thoughts swim in your mind, a mixture of sadness and bitterness accompanying them. Your mood shifts and Yoonji knows it does– It’s like she can read the very hazy, fearful words on your mind despite you having said nothing. Her grip on your thigh tightens until you turn to look at her, and its like she can hear every little thought running through your head. She blinks and there’s a little bit more focus and anxiety in her gaze, mixing in with her adoration towards you.

“It’s okay.”

It the words that her little lips silently whisper when they part and suddenly you feel like everything is okay again. That’s the power of Min Yoonji– Better yet, it just may be the power that coexists between two lovers, but you know Yoonji would tease you for saying something as cheesy as that. So, with the suddenness of rain on a sunny day, you’re fine again.
For now, at least.

Jungkook and Jimin return and Yoonji’s hand falls from your thigh with slickness and ease that has you wishing it was back again. But you’re thankful for it all the same because Jungkook and Jimin are utterly clueless to it. Dishes clatter and empty stomachs sing as the tantalizing scent of food harass each of you. You sing your compliments to Jungkook, to which he beams brighter than the sun in response to. Then eagerly, you devour the meal before you, joyful conversation filling the air as a sense of peace befalls you.

It’s a happy, pleasant atmosphere that lingers during the meal, after it is over, when you all watch a movie together, and then finally when the sun gives her final goodbyes and leaves with her lover, Moon, taking her place with grace and class. Jungkook and Jimin apologize and excuse themselves to their room since they both have early shifts the next day, hug and pepper your cheeks in playfully sloppy kisses (an action to which you notice Yoonji dislikes, you see it in the way her eyes slide to the side, how her gaze dims, how her hands tighten) and then suddenly, its only you and Yoonji.

You’ll be sleeping in her room for the next bit you’re here and honestly, the arrangement is perfect for the two of you. Into her room you and she go, the door clicking softly shut behind you. You pause, turning back to lock the door and as you do, you can feel Yoonji hovering near. She’s always been hot– Temperature-wise, that is. So when her warm hands clutch your cool arms, when soft, heated lips press themselves to the back of your icy neck, and when a soft groan falls from her lips and makes the hair on your entire being stand up, you freeze. You soak it in, soak in the way it feels so familiar to have her pressing against you like this. Her hands drop to your hips as she practically pins you against the door, a sigh dripping from you like sap from a tree. You feel like you are burning as you manage to turn around, meeting your lovers gaze with unsteady eyes. She’s closer now, closer for you to look at and you see it clear as day.

She is not well.

Yoonji, oblivious, leans forward on the tips of her toes and attempts to kiss you, but you stop her when your hands suddenly clutch her cheeks. She freezes, her head laying heavy in your grip. You almost can’t believe it, the dramatic change that your girl has gone through, but you know trauma changes a person. So you pull her close and run your fingers through her hair, plant a kiss to her cheek, then softly whisper–

“We need to talk.”

Yoonji hesitates but pulls back to stare you in your eyes. She inches out of your grip and you notice her fear.

“Are… Are we breaking up?”

“No, no,” You say, an airy, lifeless, laugh with your words, “But this is about you, baby…”

You slide past, taking a seat on the edge of her bed and patting the space next to you. Yoonji follows obediently, sitting so close her thigh touches yours. You grab her hands and hold them in your own, staring at the veins pumping blood beneath the flesh. You’ve always loved those hands of hers, they’re probably your favorite trait on her besides her, well… Her everything. You plant kisses to the tips of each finger until you’ve done all ten, until you realize Yoonji’s eyes are glazed over like she’s a million miles away or like she may even pass out right then and there. You snap your own fingers and she clicks back into awareness so suddenly that it frightens you.

“What’s the matter?” Yoonji asks as if nothing happened, imploring you to reply and finally talk, “Cat got your tongue?”

She means it as a joke but you can’t even fake a laugh.

“…Yoonji,” You start softly, “How are you…”

You pause, take in a deep breath to halt the stinging of tears in your eyes, then force out the words.

“How have you been since Yoongi and Hoseok died?”

It’s a question Yoonji doesn’t know how to answer.

You can’t even remember the last time you’ve taken a well-deserved break, let alone had a good time out and about with your closest friends.

It really has been ages, but it isn’t by choice… Well, maybe you did kind of do this to yourself, but not as a conscious decision. You’re just so fucking busy– Constantly smothered with assignment after assignment, and with your terrible time management skills, you’re always rushing to get things done just in the nick of time. It’s because of this that you’re constantly playing a catch-up game that saps up any free time you might possibly have. You’re usually crammed in your apartment because of this and a lot of the time your head is a mess of formulas you don’t care for and poets you can’t care to remember. But this week is different.

You can’t even remember the last time you’ve taken a well-deserved break, let alone had a good time out and about with your closest friends.

It really has been ages, but it isn’t by choice… Well, maybe you did kind of do this to yourself, but not as a conscious decision. You’re just so fucking busy– Constantly smothered with assignment after assignment, and with your terrible time management skills, you’re always rushing to get things done just in the nick of time. It’s because of this that you’re constantly playing a catch-up game that saps up any free time you might possibly have. You’re usually crammed in your apartment because of this and a lot of the time your head is a mess of formulas you don’t care for and poets you can’t care to remember. But this week is different.

[[MORE]]

Lately, you’ve taken on a new regimen when you work on your assignments and it keeps you focused enough to get your work together without the distractions. You’ve been doing so well as of late that you’ve finally had some time where instead of hunching over a desk full of papers, you’re just chilling out without a single educational thing on your mind. It’s peaceful, really. So when your close friend Jungkook hits you up one day, practically begging you to spend some time at his place, you’re happy to say that you can agree without much of a regret in doing so.

The drive down is long, but you’re anxious to see Jungkook as well as his roommates, which happen to be more friends of yours. You live far from them all and you longed to see them for ages now, so to say you are excited it an understatement. As you drive, you can practically hear Jungkook’s teasing quips and remarks now– He always had a stupidly sharp tongue and a mouth that moved faster than his god damn brain, so the bullshit that flies from his mouth is… Interesting, to say the least.

Then there’s Jimin, the demonic entity you’ve had the absolute pleasure and displeasure of knowing. He’s crazy intelligent, but underhanded all the same– You can still remember that one time he nearly dragged you into a robbery. He had it all planned out, all wrapped up in a pretty red bow and with those cute, plump lips of his and that easy going smile, you could’ve fallen for it. His plan, he admitted later when it all fell through, was for you to be the getaway driver for another person who would do the actual robbery and it could’ve worked if you didn’t know him so well…

Of course, you kinda knew what was up since you’ve done something similar among many, many other things. You try not to think about that part in your life much. Between the near fucking deaths and necromancy, you really were an entirely different person compared to who you are now. It’s growth, really.

You’re sure you’ll see Taehyung, too, yet another creative character. He’s an art major as well a self-proclaimed artistic genius and intellectual even though he borderline fails every single fuckin class besides those pertaining to art. He really is a wonder when it comes down to it, though, and in more ways than one. One time he was failing literature and managed to dig up enough dirt on his married literature teacher’s affair with yet another teacher that she had literally no other option than to boost Taehyung’s grade up to an A. It lasted for the entire year, too, and then when Taehyung changed courses he snitched anyway. When you asked him about it he just said something along the lines of “she earned it” and nothing else at all on the matter ever again, so yeah. That’s Kim Taehyung.

When you finally pull into the parking lot of their apartment complex and park, you’re exhausted. Ravenous, too– Your dumb ass forgot to eat before you left, of all things, and you know once Jungkook finds out about that as well as you’re rather unstable eating habits, he’ll probably have a knife to your neck and spoon feed you himself. You wouldn’t mind it much, though, because that’s the way Jungkook is and how he expresses affection. Also… you wouldn’t mind him waiting on you hand and foot to cater to you. In fact, you might just fuck around and collapse as soon as you step into the apartment just so he can do exactly that… Fuck yeah.

You hop out of the car, rolling your neck and shoulders. Your muscles pop as you dig out your phone, pulling up Jungkook’s number to shoot him a text.

“hey”
“im outside”

You begin typing your third text message, but by the time you get to the word my of “help me get my bags out the car” you can hear the sound of a door flying open somewhere and a loud, cheery voice absolutely screaming–

“IT’S MY FUCKING GIRL!”

With his arms outstretched wide and a cheeky, blinding grin, you look up to see Jungkook standing at the doorway of a nearby unit. You grin, chuckling lightly as you throw up your hand in a wave. He’s so happy, so, so happy that he doesn’t even realize the glass screen door is swinging back until it hits him.

Literally…

Hits him.

It swings back into his face hard enough for him to flinch as the sound of glass hitting skin rings clear and he loses his balance, fucking collapsing right then and there. You flinch yourself at the impact and cringe.

“…Ah,”

You mumble it aloud softly as you slowly drop your arm. Looks like Jungkook still has that clumsy, awkward phase going on. It’s cute, yeah. In a sad sort of way.

You see Jimin appear behind the door, see him staring down at his roommate with an almost tired look. Jungkook raises his arm up as if asking for Jimin’s help and to your very little surprise, Jimin just fucking steps over Jungkook’s body and out the door.

“Y/n!” Jimin calls, hopping down the steps with graceful, vigorous movements, glancing up between you and the stairs beneath his feet as if the interaction with Jungkook never happened.

Soon he touches the ground and dashes up to you with rushed movements, but the sight of the male has you borderline swooning. Jimin is utterly, wholly, entirely adorable. The way the sun is shining down, beams of light kissing his honey cheeks and staining his skin in its healing light, his dark eyes like crescents, arms out wide, he looks like a devious little angel– You don’t know whether to be scared or happy to see his dangerously pretty ass. In the next moment, Jimin is slinging his arms around you before you can decide which part of your fight or flight response you want to utilize and christ is his hug tight– Bone crushing, honestly. Still, he smells like pancakes and warm syrup, like all the good things you adore. Like home, really. As your arms wrap around the male in return, you almost feel like you’re safe in his grasp.

…Almost.
You know damn well never to totally let your guard down around that demon.

“Oh god, Y/n, it’s been so long,” He pulls away to look you over, “…How are you? Are you well? Ahh–”

His hands suddenly grip your cheeks and turns your head from side to side hard enough for your damn neck to pop.

“Oh goodness, your skin is…”

He pauses, milky eyes gazing into your own for a moment. You can feel yourself burning by the second because he’s staring at you so fucking intently, until–

“Y/n, your skin is really dried out. Do you even moisturize? Do you just rub fucking acid on your face? What the fuck?” He squints, lips parting, “…Why is it so dry…”

See?
This is why you have trust issues with Park Jimin– It’s always some sneaky, underhanded bullshit with him.

He twists your head a couple more times, your neck pops, and it takes you physical effort to keep from swinging on him.

“Aight, aight. I get it my face is ugly, jesus christ,” You grab his hands and jerk them off of your skin, “You couldn’t just say hey like a regular person, Park?”

“First of all,” Jimin starts, cocking a brow. He wiggles his hands until he holds your own, “Never said you’re ugly. You’re the prettiest girl in the whole wide world, Petunia~”

His tone turns flirtatiously melodic and your groan with a roll of your eyes.

“I see the months apart haven’t changed that part of you,” You mumble.

“What part?” Counters Jimin with enthusiastic defiance, perking up, “The part of me that still feels nothin’ but a– a burning desire to be with you? The part of me that wants you!?”

“Oh my god– Jimin,” You hiss with a scowl, “Don’t say that so loudly. It’s weird.”

You’re really a bit embarrassed because he’s borderline yelling and it doesn’t help at all that you can see an older African lady on her porch watching the two of you from a distance. She looks almost disgusted, kinda, but you get it. For some reason, you have the feeling if you saw a scene like the one you’re currently in, you’d be disgusted too.

“Why not?” Jimin replies, leaning against your car as he eases closer to you, “Embarrassed, Petunia?”

“More like disgusted,” You remark with a snarl to your lips and a gag to punctuate your words. You spin around, ignoring Jimin’s immediate pout when you’re no longer within flirting range. You walk to the other side of the car, pull open the door, grab your purse off the floor of the back seat, and gesture rather vaguely to the rest as Jimin approaches.

“Help me get my bags out the car and invite me in already,” You ask– No, demand, “A certain bitch is tired, her back hurts, and if she doesn’t get something in her guts soon, her stomach is just gonna start eating away at itself.”

“I could put something in your guts now,” Jimin says with a smug smile and coy shrug, “If you want it. No cooking required– I could have you satisfied in seconds, Petunia.”

You glance him over, brows raised. Your expression is almost impressed, honestly. Jimin is beginning to feel flushed with pride at his little remark when your brain shuts down and you fucking reply with a genuine–

“Oh fuck, you carry a Snickers on you?”

Jimin’s face drops, “W… Wait, what–”

“Can I have it?” You go on, “I’m fucking starving. I think if I don’t eat soon my organs are gonna shut down or something.”

Jimin pauses.

“I, uh. That wasn’t… what I meant,” He shifts from foot to foot, your oblivious expression only making things worse.

“Y/n, I was talking about my di–”

“Baby!”

You gasp, wind entirely knocked out of you when strong arms suddenly wrap around your form. He squeezes you tightly from behind, but it feels more like you’re being attacked than affectionately hugged.

“Oh FUCK, Jungkook!” You screech when you realize it’s him, “You scared the shit outta me– Hey, get off! I can’t breathe!”

“Sorry, sorry–” Jungkook mumbles, but he hesitates a moment before finally pulling away.

You turn to look at him with a playful glare, punching his chest lightly.

“I see you’re still the same clumsy motherfucker, huh?” You tease, punching him again as your glare turns into a grin, “What was that up there at the balcony? You were practically sucker punched by a fucking door, you know that?”

“Hey, that’s rude to say when you only just got here,” Jungkook whines, shoving you back in your shoulder, “I got hurt saying hi to you so technically it’s your fault I’m hurt.”

“Nuh uh!” You exclaim, slamming your palms into his chest, “You’re the clumsy jackass so it’s not my fault.”

“Yes,” He shoves you back, “It is, too, your fault.”

“It is not!”

“It is, too!”

“Is not!”

“Is, too!”

“Is n–”

But before you can finish, Jimin clamps his hand over your mouth and exhaustedly says, “You both sound like two full-fledged fucking fools, I swear to god. Can we go inside already?”

You and Jungkook glance back at him, a pout on your face.

“Fine,” You huff, ripping Jimin’s hand away from your face.

You step aside, letting Jimin and Jungkook get your two suitcases for you. It’s when the three of you are walking toward the apartment with Jimin leading the way, you whisper hotly–

“Is not, Jeon Jungkook, my fault.”

Just for extra measure, you dig your fingers into Jungkook’s waist and smile smugly when he squirms under your touch. The three of you walk closer still until Jimin pauses just before the stairs. You know him so well– So extremely well that when his plump lips part and a dazzling grin graces his handsome face, when he respectfully dips his head toward the African woman on her porch, you know almost instantaneously that he’s forcing it. And Jungkook, too, is forcing his smile as he bows lightly toward the woman. Really, they both look… Nervous. You’re intrigued.

Jimin starts first.

“Hello, bibi–”

“Don’t talk to me.”

And all it takes is for her to say those four words for Park Jimin to shut his fucking mouth. You watch as he leans back, chewing his inner cheek as he nods pointlessly, a defeated expression on his face. Even Jungkook looks like he’s been silenced and he never even said anything. You’re amazed, honestly. Clearly, this woman commands a lot of respect already– You can tell by the way her plump lips stay in a tight line, how her dark eyes are so focused and how her gaze is strict, as if she takes zero bullshit. Really, its like she can see right through Jungkook and Jimin. Or maybe they just really pissed her off. Could be both, though.

…It’s probably both.

“That your boyfriend?”

“Huh?” You reply, a bit surprised when she suddenly addresses you. She looks just as powerful when she glares at you and you suddenly feel as meek as Jungkook and Jimin.

“Your boyfriend,” She asks again, but it’s much less like a question and much more like a demand. She nods her head at Jimin and you jump, finally getting her question.

“Oh!” You exclaim, scrambling for words as you wave your hands dismissively, “No, Jimin and I, we, uh, we’re just–”

“If he’s your boyfriend, you should know he cheating on you,” She announces immediately.

You would guess you took too long to answer her and that’s why she phrased it that way if it weren’t for the fact that she just said what she said. You stutter in your words, broken syllables falling from your lips as you quickly turn to look at Jimin. He looks caught and the funny part about it is that the two of you aren’t even dating.

Jimin, embarrassed, scrambles for an explanation as he glances between you, Jungkook, and finally to Bibi.

“Wait, no, bibi,” he chuckles nervously, “Y/n and I aren’t–”

“I’ve been livin’ here for fourteen years and in the last few months these children have been here, I’ve seen every kind of girl you can imagine in and out that apartment. Its either you’re runnin’ ‘round or you must be trying to raise an orphanage, cuz this is the sixth girl ive seen you with this week.”

“Jimin, oh my god…"You mumble, barely keeping in your laughter. You fake like you’re shocked, cupping your hand over your mouth. Then, in a twisted sort of way, you say, "I can’t believe you’re cheating on me–”

“Y/n–” Jimin hisses, fucking exhausted. His eyes flare with a warning when he glares at you, but it’s not like his three-foot tall self could beat your ass anyway, so the chances of you actually stopping are very low.

“What happened, Jimin?” You go on, faking total shock, “In the parking lot just now, you were just talking about the part of you that still feels a burning desire to be with me? What happened to the part of you that wants me!?”

You swear you see Jimin’s eye twitch and you know for an absolute, complete fact he is already thinking of ways to get you back. He’s probably considering lighting your precious clothes on fire which, by the way, is something he has done to you before. To which you responded by nearly setting the hay atop his head that he claims to be hair on fire. And you would’ve fucking done it, too, but then his last roommate, a tall, giraffe legged motherfucker, grabbed you and you ended up fighting the roommate instead. Long story short, Jimin wound up completely physically fine and the only person who got hurt was his previous roommate, Namjoon, who ended with a black eye and then moved out. It worked in your favor though, because Jimin was so strapped on cash for months afterward trying to pay for that whole apartment by himself that you felt like you’d still gotten your revenge.

“Look, bibi, we aren’t really dating,” Jimin tries to speak calmly.

“So,” Bibi cocks a brow, “You lied when you told me your girlfriend was coming to town.”

You snort audibly, but Bibi’s quick glance has you shutting your big mouth. You mumble an apology, but really you’re just amazed at how fucking delusional Jimin is as well as how… blunt Bibi is. Jimin lies and tells her you’re his girlfriend stopping by for a visit, then Bibi, apparently aware of all the other girls Jimin’s been fucking or whatever, tattles on him the second you arrive. It’s fucking comical, honestly, but you must admit, you’re starting to like this fierce old woman.

Jimin cringes, then drops his head and nods, “Yeah… I did.”

Bibi just looks at him for a moment, her brows furrowed and lips parted in disgust, nearly. She then shakes her head and mumbles something, then waves Jimin off. She doesn’t even need to say anything else, Jimin just murmurs a “Goodbye, Bibi,” and then rushes up the rest of the steps into the apartment. Bibi glances at Jungkook too, and Jungkook awkwardly follows in Jimin’s steps and starts to leave. You’re about to say bye and part ways as well when Bibi stops you. She holds up her hand to get your attention and you freeze.

“Yes?” You tilt your head at her, “Is something wrong?”

She looks you over, as if deciding whether or not you’re worth her breath, and then says–

“Don’t sleep with that boy. The girl he was with yesterday had crabs.”

And then she gets up and walks inside of her apartment, the door banging shut behind her.

You just stand there for a moment, your mouth agape until you hear Jungkook’s voice call out to you.

“Y/n! Are you almost done talking to Bibi? I cooked and I really want us to sit down and eat together.”

“Huh?” You turn and look up at Jungkook’s expectant face. It takes you a split second to register Jungkook’s words because Bibi’s are still ringing in your ears, but you eventually do and nod.

“Y-Yeah,” You mumble, shaking your head as if to snap back into your normal self before Jungkook gets suspicious.

“I’m, uh. Comin’ up now.”

And then you grin.
And it’s fake.
…And Jungkook can tell your grin is fake as hell, but he doesn’t say anything when you make your way up and enter the apartment.

The place is neat and tidy. Homey. White walls peppered with photo after photo of Jungkook and Jimin together, of each of them separately, of Taehyung, and of Jimin and Jungkook’s family as well. The furniture is worn, but far from decayed. It is comfortably warm inside as well but the heat is mostly stemming from the kitchen. Jimin, who watches you taking everything in with an attentively curious gaze, tugs on your jacket until you follow along and shrug it off of your shoulders. He hangs it up for you and as he does, you slip off into the kitchen. You pause, leaning against the wall for a moment to deeply inhale the scent from within. It’s savory and sweet all at once, enough to have your stomach whining and mouthwatering. The sound of a spoon tapping against a pot calls you back to earth and you open your eyes to see Jungkook stirring the food.

“I.. cooked a lot,” He announces softly. Embarrassed is what he sounds like, “I didn’t know how much you would eat or what you even preferred, so I kind of got carried away.”

He grins sheepishly, then turns to glance up at you, “You will eat… right?”

You gaze at him for a moment, then grin, a wave of adoration hitting you that makes you want to pinch his cheeks.

“Oh, of course. I could eat all this–” You make a wide, general gesture out toward the kitchen, “–And then some.”

“Good!” Jungkook exclaims.

By the soft flush to his cheeks and the way he gracefully checks the oven, he’s clearly satisfied with your answer. But because you just have to fuck with people, you clear your throat and say–

“Or not.”

Jungkook freezes.

“…What?”

“Oh, you know~,” You stretch flippantly, movements flamboyant and overdramatic, “I might not actually be able to eat all of this after all.”

“Huh? Wait, no, why not?” Jungkook presses, letting go of the spoon and leaving it in the pot. He looks distressed and you know you’re being mean but you also… Don’t care enough to stop. Besides, after all the times Jungkook teased you over shit, revenge is only necessary, right?

“Are you not hungry? Or something?”

“No, no. I’m plenty hungry,” You turn around, cross your hands behind your back and deliberately edge away from him, “It’s just…”

Jungkook steps closer, tilting his head.

“Just?” He urges.

“It’s just the last time I checked, your cooking was–”

But your teasing quip is cut short when you suddenly hear a slightly feminine voice call out a groggy–

“What’s up with all the noise? This is the second time you ’ve woken me up on one of my off days,” She calls, her words tired and slurred with an accent you know well– Better than well, actually, its a sound burned into your very soul at this point.

You hear Jimin start to respond to her, but you’re already in motion. You rush out of the kitchen, almost tripping as you round the corner until suddenly you see her physically before you. And there, just down the hall, is where she stands– In clear view is no one else besides Min Yoonji. Her jet black locks are silken and messy all the same, strands sticking out here and there. Those familiar dark eyes of hers are tired– Hazy. Her tone is sun-kissed yet so pale all at once, its as if she’s fallen ill… Not like the Yoonji you once knew years back who’s skin was as vibrant as– No, rivaled with a freshly bloomed flower. The woman is dressed in a long black tee that stops just above her knees, black socks on her feet, black bags under her eyes to match her atmosphere. It’s a concoction of feelings that rush you when you see her, two of them very prominent all the same. One emotion is pure, honest, childish joy that stems from the very pit of your being the moment you lay eyes on her figure.

The second?

…Fear.

The last time you checked, Min Yoonji– your Min Yoonji did not look the way this Min Yoonji looks now. Staring at her sleek frame, her exhausted movements, you know she’s changed and it’s nowhere near for the better.

But you swallow it down, push that fear from your mind the moment you notice it and instead fall into excitement.

Yoonji looks… Shocked when she sees you. Her jaw falls slack, eyes blinking again and again as she gazes at you with hard, confused eyes. She even points at you, lips struggling to find words for a moment until all she says is–

“What?”

Jimin just giggles, grinning, “Y/n’s stopping by for a visit,” He explains simply.

“She’ll be here for the next few days,” Jungkook continues seamlessly as he too appears from the kitchen, a towel in his grasp that he dries his hands on, “We agreed not to tell you because Y/n wanted to surprise you.”

“Surpriseee~” You call, waving your hands like it’s some big reveal, the cheekiest of grins on your face.

Yoonji’s lips part and shut until finally, she finds a way to express her utter bewilderment and excitement. She rushes forward and you meet her halfway as she practically throws herself into your arms. You gasp when her chest slams into your own, stumbling back again as her arms wrap around your neck. Her grip is tight, her face nuzzled into your neck as quick, slurred comments on how much she’s fucking missed you fall from her lips. You giggle, squeezing her terribly skinny frame back, but in all honesty, she’s grown so thin you almost worry that you’ll snap her in half if you squeeze her even the slightest bit too hard.

“God, I missed you…” Yoonji hisses the words in your ear, her nails digging into your flesh.

“I missed you, tooooo!” You whine back, rocking the two of you from side to side.

In all honesty, the hug is far too short, but you and Min Yoonji are well aware of Jimin and Jungkook who stand closely behind. So you part ways just as quickly as you begin and suppress your feelings for now.

“Oh, it’s so nice to be with you all again,” You remark, glancing at Jungkook’s glimmering smile, Jimin’s flushed cheeks, and then a quick glance at Yoonji’s lips before you turn back to the boys, “If I could be here all the time, I would–”

“You should, then!” Jimin exclaims, suddenly grabbing you by your hands and pulling toward the kitchen table, “Stay with us! We’d make some room for you!”

Yoonji smirks, following along, “Yeah, we’d kick Jungkook’s ass out and you can take his room.”

“Heeey!” Jungkook retorts, glaring at your Yoonji, “Why do I get kicked out? Why not Jimin?”

“Because I can stand Jimin a little bit more than I can stand you–”

And then she jabs her pointed finger into Jungkook’s chest for extra measure. The male whines, clutching his injured chest and you giggle at the sight. Still bickering and fussing as always– They really never changed. But the lack of change in your dynamic is warming, all the same. Even after leaving for months, you can still come home to the people you love and feel nothing but comfort.

The four of you take your seats at the roundtable, Yoonji on your left, Jungook on your right, and Jimin across. When Jungkook slips into the kitchen to make the plates of food, he calls Jimin in for his help. It’s after the shorter male shoots you one of his dazzling smiles, sticks his tongue out at Yoonji, then dips off into the kitchen, you feel her hand come to squeeze your thigh. You catch her gaze for a moment, eyes hooded as you take in her form. Yoonji’s face rests in her left hand as she gazes at you with soft eyes, blinking with the slow, carefulness of a feline. A million emotions stir within her shimmering gaze and you wonder how it is possible for one person to carry stars in their eyes. You gaze down at her hand, at the bony joints and slender fingers that clutch the plump flesh of your thigh. Her hands have always been big, and you’ve always loved the way they look wrapped around your own, how they feel when they clutch your cheeks…

You laugh then when you feel the urge to kiss her hit you strong and you’re suddenly too embarrassed to even look at her anymore. Your skin, soft and supple, burns where her palm lingers– Taunting you with the sensation. Far too long has it been since the two of you seen each other last, and now that the two of you are finally together, holding back for the sake of Jimin and Jungkook is borderline hellish. The two of you are lesbians, after all, closeted lesbians, and neither one of you are ready to come out. Even with the two boys, there is always that fear that you’ll be looked at differently for admitting to being lovers– It already didn’t go well with either one of your parents. Yoonji’s momma practically disowned her when Yoonji came out to her some years ago, and your mother claims she doesn’t think of you any differently now, but you know she does. So after coming out to people who claimed to love you unconditionally only to run head-first into a condition, why risk it again?

These thoughts swim in your mind, a mixture of sadness and bitterness accompanying them. Your mood shifts and Yoonji knows it does– It’s like she can read the very hazy, fearful words on your mind despite you having said nothing. Her grip on your thigh tightens until you turn to look at her, and its like she can hear every little thought running through your head. She blinks and there’s a little bit more focus and anxiety in her gaze, mixing in with her adoration towards you.

“It’s okay.”

It the words that her little lips silently whisper when they part and suddenly you feel like everything is okay again. That’s the power of Min Yoonji– Better yet, it just may be the power that coexists between two lovers, but you know Yoonji would tease you for saying something as cheesy as that. So, with the suddenness of rain on a sunny day, you’re fine again.
For now, at least.

Jungkook and Jimin return and Yoonji’s hand falls from your thigh with slickness and ease that has you wishing it was back again. But you’re thankful for it all the same because Jungkook and Jimin are utterly clueless to it. Dishes clatter and empty stomachs sing as the tantalizing scent of food harass each of you. You sing your compliments to Jungkook, to which he beams brighter than the sun in response to. Then eagerly, you devour the meal before you, joyful conversation filling the air as a sense of peace befalls you.

It’s a happy, pleasant atmosphere that lingers during the meal, after it is over, when you all watch a movie together, and then finally when the sun gives her final goodbyes and leaves with her lover, Moon, taking her place with grace and class. Jungkook and Jimin apologize and excuse themselves to their room since they both have early shifts the next day, hug and pepper your cheeks in playfully sloppy kisses (an action to which you notice Yoonji dislikes, you see it in the way her eyes slide to the side, how her gaze dims, how her hands tighten) and then suddenly, its only you and Yoonji.

You’ll be sleeping in her room for the next bit you’re here and honestly, the arrangement is perfect for the two of you. Into her room you and she go, the door clicking softly shut behind you. You pause, turning back to lock the door and as you do, you can feel Yoonji hovering near. She’s always been hot– Temperature-wise, that is. So when her warm hands clutch your cool arms, when soft, heated lips press themselves to the back of your icy neck, and when a soft groan falls from her lips and makes the hair on your entire being stand up, you freeze. You soak it in, soak in the way it feels so familiar to have her pressing against you like this. Her hands drop to your hips as she practically pins you against the door, a sigh dripping from you like sap from a tree. You feel like you are burning as you manage to turn around, meeting your lovers gaze with unsteady eyes. She’s closer now, closer for you to look at and you see it clear as day.

She is not well.

Yoonji, oblivious, leans forward on the tips of her toes and attempts to kiss you, but you stop her when your hands suddenly clutch her cheeks. She freezes, her head laying heavy in your grip. You almost can’t believe it, the dramatic change that your girl has gone through, but you know trauma changes a person. So you pull her close and run your fingers through her hair, plant a kiss to her cheek, then softly whisper–

“We need to talk.”

Yoonji hesitates but pulls back to stare you in your eyes. She inches out of your grip and you notice her fear.

“Are… Are we breaking up?”

“No, no,” You say, an airy, lifeless, laugh with your words, “But this is about you, baby…”

You slide past, taking a seat on the edge of her bed and patting the space next to you. Yoonji follows obediently, sitting so close her thigh touches yours. You grab her hands and hold them in your own, staring at the veins pumping blood beneath the flesh. You’ve always loved those hands of hers, they’re probably your favorite trait on her besides her, well… Her everything. You plant kisses to the tips of each finger until you’ve done all ten, until you realize Yoonji’s eyes are glazed over like she’s a million miles away or like she may even pass out right then and there. You snap your own fingers and she clicks back into awareness so suddenly that it frightens you.

“What’s the matter?” Yoonji asks as if nothing happened, imploring you to reply and finally talk, “Cat got your tongue?”

She means it as a joke but you can’t even fake a laugh.

“…Yoonji,” You start softly, “How are you…”

You pause, take in a deep breath to halt the stinging of tears in your eyes, then force out the words.

“How have you been since Yoongi and Hoseok died?”

It’s a question Yoonji doesn’t know how to answer.
